settings.html: The Barco Nio MDNC-6121 is a cutting-edge color digital mammography LCD monitor with LED backlight, designed specifically for viewing 2D and 3D Tomosynthesis breast images. This specialized monitor, equipped with a high-resolution 6MP resolution (MDNC-6121 has higher resolution than tradition 5MP displays) per display, is built to offer unparalleled image precision and diagnostic confidence. The MDNC-6121 takes advantage of Barco's sophisticated display technology to deliver consistent, high-quality images with accurate colors, enabling radiologists to detect the smallest details for enhanced diagnosis. Its LED backlight ensures bright, clear images while also offering energy efficiency and long life of over 50,000 hours of usage. In addition to its imaging capabilities, the MDNC-6121 is also designed with user comfort in mind. It comes with adjustable features to ensure an ergonomic viewing experience, which can reduce eye strain and fatigue during long reading sessions. Further, the MDNC-6121 integrates seamlessly with Barco's suite of productivity tools and quality assurance measures. This integration allows for streamlined workflow and optimal utilization of the monitor's capabilities, thereby supporting high-quality patient care. In a field where precision and clarity are paramount, the Barco Nio MDNC-6121 stands out as an exceptional tool for radiologists and healthcare providers, promising accurate and efficient diagnostic practices.

settings.title: Greyscale & Color DICOM Calibration with Barco's I-Guard Technology
settings.content:
Barco MDNC-6121 I-Guard sensor technology incorporates an integrated front-of-screen photometer that continuously evaluates image quality, ensuring consistent and accurate DICOM calibration.

With I-Guard technology, the Barco Nio MDNC-6121 can automatically adjust brightness and grayscale levels in real-time, compensating for any ambient light changes and display aging. This means radiologists can trust that they're always looking at consistent and accurate images, regardless of external conditions.

settings.title: Uniform Luminance Technology
settings.content: The Barco Nio MDNC-6121, fortified with Barco's Uniform Luminance Technology (ULT), addresses challenges faced by radiologists due to uneven brightness in traditional LCD displays. These conventional screens often present luminance discrepancies in over a quarter of their viewing area, which can distort images and degrade quality. ULT, however, counteracts these luminance and color inconsistencies, ensuring full compliance with DICOM GSDF (Grayscale Standard Display Function) standards across the entire screen. This technology empowers radiologists with consistent, high-quality images, thereby enhancing diagnostic precision.

settings.title: Revolutionary CSDF Calibration
settings.content: Experience the exceptional Color Standard Display Function (CSDF) calibration capabilities of the Barco Nio MDNC-6121, meticulously designed to meet the dynamic requirements of radiologists and pathologists. The CSDF calibration introduces an innovative color calibration method that complements the established GSDF (Greyscale Standard Display Function), addressing the unique needs of these healthcare professionals. This cutting-edge technology not only enhances grayscale performance but also ensures the accurate representation of colors in multi-modality imaging environments. CSDF calibration allows medical images to be displayed with unparalleled color precision, facilitating improved lesion detection, tissue differentiation, and consequently, more accurate clinical evaluations.

settings.title: SpotViewâ„¢
settings.content: SpotView enhances display brightness within a specified circular region of interest, making intricate details more visible. It dynamically improves contrast and, if necessary, magnifies or inverts pixels within the SpotView zone, providing an optimized viewing experience for identifying subtle discrepancies. This function is particularly useful for detailed examinations, allowing radiologists to better detect minute variations that could be critical in making an accurate diagnosis.

settings.title: Ambient Light Compensation (ALC)
settings.content: The Barco Nio MDNC-6121, fortified with Barco's Uniform Luminance Technology (ULT), addresses challenges faced by radiologists due to uneven brightness in traditional LCD displays. These conventional screens often present luminance discrepancies in over a quarter of their viewing area, which can distort images and degrade quality. ULT, however, counteracts these luminance and color inconsistencies, ensuring full compliance with DICOM GSDF (Grayscale Standard Display Function) standards across the entire screen. This technology empowers radiologists with consistent, high-quality images, thereby enhancing diagnostic precision.

settings.title: DimView
settings.content:
DimView selectively dims auxiliary displays used for patient worklists or dictation. By minimizing peripheral light during readings, it allows the user's eyes to concentrate on the diagnostic screen, reducing visual distractions.

Users have the flexibility to choose which display(s) should automatically dim when the cursor is not active over them. They can dim each display individually using DimView, or synchronize the dimming of all additional displays with DimView Link, thereby customizing their viewing experience according to their specific needs. This feature enhances user comfort and focus, contributing to a more efficient and effective diagnostic process.

settings.title: MDNC-6121 has Adaptable Stand
settings.content: The stand accompanying the Barco Nio MDNC-6121 is engineered for exceptional user comfort and flexibility. It offers a range of adjustments including tilt, swivel, and height, enabling users to position the monitor at their most comfortable viewing angle. In addition to these ergonomic features, the stand includes a connector compartment cover designed to conceal cables, ensuring a tidy and organized workspace.

settings.title: 3D Tomosynthesis
settings.content: Barco MDNC-6121 feature advanced 3D tomosynthesis capabilities, providing a more comprehensive and accurate view of breast tissue. This state-of-the-art technology allows radiologists to examine a series of high-resolution images from different angles, effectively creating a three-dimensional reconstruction of the breast.

settings.title: Enhanced Clarity for Radiologists with Anti-Reflective Glass
settings.content: MDNC-6121 display offers an optional anti-reflective coated protective glass that significantly enhances visual acuity and performance for radiologists. This advanced glass technology reduces glare and reflections, enabling healthcare professionals to scrutinize images with remarkable sharpness and accuracy. By mitigating visual disruptions, the anti-reflective coated protective glass allows radiologists to focus on key details, leading to more precise diagnoses and improved patient outcomes.

settings.title: Barco QAWeb Calibration & QA Software
settings.content: In line with all Barco medical display systems, the MDNC-6121 is furnished with the practicality of MediCal QAWeb. This can be utilized as a standalone installation on a local workstation or as a cloud-based subscription technology for automated calibration and Quality Assurance. This feature guarantees maximum display uptime, eliminating the need for manual intervention. Through MediCal QAWeb, Barco ensures consistent high-quality performance and enhanced operational efficiency of the MDNC-6121 display system.

settings.title: MDNC-6121: Light & Modern Design
settings.content: The Barco Nio MDNC-6121 medical display monitor strikes an ideal balance between size, weight, functionality, and convenience. Standing at 528mm (20.7 inches) tall, with a width of 378mm (14.8 inches) and a depth of 235mm (9.2 inches) per monitor, it offers an expansive viewing area for radiologists. Weighing 11.6kg (25.5 lbs) with the stand and 6.6kg (14.5 lbs) without it per monitor, the Barco Nio MDNC-6121 is a robust and enduring piece of equipment. Whether used in a hospital setting or a home office, the Nio MDNC-6121 is an exemplary breast imaging display for radiologists in search of an optimal blend of size, performance, and image quality.

settings.title: SmartCursor: Effortless Cursor Movement Across Varied Displays
settings.content: Are you regularly encountering the frustrating issue of cursor trapping at the borders of differently sized displays? Barco's SmartCursorâ„¢ is the perfect solution for this challenge. This beneficial feature eliminates the problem of cursor sticking on the edges of adjacent displays with varying dimensions, ensuring smooth navigation. To enable SmartCursorâ„¢, simply head to the Barco System Settings and select the SmartCursorâ„¢ option. Once activated, you'll enjoy effortless cursor movement across all your radiology workstation displays, which can streamline your workflow and minimize disruptions during critical diagnostic tasks.

settings.title: MDNC-6121 & MXRT: Peerless Diagnostic Accuracy
settings.content: Elevate your viewing experience by combining the Barco Nio MDNC-6121 with a Barco MXRT graphics card. This potent duo offers exceptional image quality and performance, ensuring precise and efficient diagnostic capabilities for radiologists. The MXRT-5600, MXRT-6700, MXRT-7600, and MXRT-8700 graphics cards are specifically engineered to augment the abilities of the MDNC-6121, delivering seamless integration and the highest image quality in the medical imaging domain. Experience unmatched clarity and precision in your diagnostic process by opting for the Barco MDNC-6121 and MXRT graphics card package.
